arm_group.description:
Women fulfilling at least two of the three Rotterdam criteria for PCOS, including
Irregular menstrual cycle
Clinical/biochemical hyperandrogenemia
Polycystic ovaries

brief_summary.textblock:
Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is a common endocrine disorder in premenopausal women. PCOS
      is characterized by increase levels of testosterone, unwanted hair growth, adiposity,
      irregular menstrual cycle, and infertility. PCOS is associated with diabetes mellitus and
      cardiovascular diseases. Women with PCOS are reported to have increased levels of stress
      hormones, which may be associated with decreased quality of life. Increased testosterone
      levels in women may decrease the risk of osteoporosis. The aim of the present study is to
      measure levels of stress hormones in urine and describe quality of life using
      questionnaires. In addition we aim to characterize body composition and bone architecture
      using DXA and ExtremeCT.

      As part of the project, a Biobank with fasting blood samples from participants is
      established.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization of a Prospective Cohort of Women With PCOS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  PCOS

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnancy

study_pop.textblock:
Women with PCOS, diagnosed by the Rotterdam criteria which include at least two of the
        following:

          -  irregular mestrual cycle

          -  polycystic ovaries

          -  biochemical/clinical hyperandrogenemia

facility.name: Department of Endocrinology, Odense University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Metabolic and Endocrinological Characterization of a Prospective Cohort of Women With PCOS

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Endocrinology, Odense University Hospital

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Danish National Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: BMD measured by DXA scans and ExtremeCT scans.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of cortisol and steroid metabolites in 24 hour urine samples
